data.title: Xavier University Athletics
data.meta_description: CINCINNATI – Xavier University's Quincy Olivari has been selected to the Division I East All-Stars Roster for the 2024 NABC – Reese's Division I College All-...
data.text:
CINCINNATI – Xavier University's Quincy Olivari has been selected to the Division I East All-Stars Roster for the 2024 NABC – Reese's Division I College All-Star Game, featuring top senior talent from across NCAA Division I.

The All-Star game will take place on Friday, April 5 at 6:30 p.m. ET (3:30 p.m. in Phoenix) at State Farm Stadium in Phoenix as part of Reese's Final Four Friday. The game will be broadcast live on CBS Sports Network, and admission to the game and Reese's Final Four Friday is free.

The night before the 2024 NABC – Reese's Division I College All-Star Game, Olivari will compete in the Hanes Men's 3-Point Championship as part of the 35th annual State Farm College Slam Dunk & 3-Point Championships at Grand Canyon University in Phoenix on Thursday, April 4. Olivari is one of eight players that will participate in the 3-point competition, which will air live on ESPN at 9 p.m. ET.

Reese's Division I East All-Stars

Jamison Battle, Ohio State

Isaiah Cozart, Eastern Kentucky

Jack Gohlke, Oakland

Jordan King, Richmond

Josh Oduro, Providence

Quincy Olivari, Xavier

Drew Pember, UNC Asheville

Quinten Post, Boston College

Tyler Thomas, Hofstra

Jahmir Young, Maryland

Head Coach: Greg Kampe, Oakland

Reese's Division I West All-Stars

Branden Carlson, Utah

Isaiah Crawford, Louisiana Tech

Sean East II, Missouri

Jesse Edwards, West Virginia

Enrique Freeman, Akron

Jalen House, New Mexico

Isaac Jones, Washington State

Gabe McGlothan, Grand Canyon

Elijah Pepper, UC Davis

Tylor Perry, Kansas State

Keisei Tominaga, Nebraska

Head Coach: Steve Lavin, San Diego

Olivari, a Xavier graduate student, broke the school record for most 3-pointers in a season with 106 in 34 games. He eclipsed the record of Trevon Bluiett, who had 105 in 35 games in the 2017-18 season. Olivari, a 2023-24 BIG EAST Honorable Mention selection, was selected by The National Association of Basketball Coaches as a 2023-24 NABC Second Team All-District 5 selection.

Olivari finished the season second in the BIG EAST Conference in scoring at 19.1 ppg. Olivari led the BIG EAST and was 18th in the nation in 3-point field goals at 3.1 per game and was third in the BIG EAST and 27th in the nation in 3-point percentage at .409.
